domain

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • domain.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board class holds Square objects, pool, ChanceCard and CommunityCard objects in the game. This class is responsible from the movement of the Player objects on the Board.

        This method provides a unique way of access to the singleton Board instance.
        Returns:
        The singleton Board instance
        Effects:
        Returns the singleton Board instance, if not have done so already, first initializes it.

      • addToCommunityCards

        public void addToCommunityCards(domain.CommunityCard card)
        Adds a CommunityCard instance to the collection of Community Cards.
        Parameters:
        card - Card to be appended to the pile of Community Cards.
        Requires:
        card is not null.
        Modifies:
        communityCards - Collection holding CommunityCard instances
        Effects:
        Adds card to the collection of Community Cards, if requirement is not met, throws IllegalArgumentException.

      • pickACommunityCard

        public domain.CommunityCard pickACommunityCard()
        Simulates picking a Community Card from a pile of Community Cards.
        Returns:
        A CommunityCard instance or null.
        Modifies:
        communityCards - Collection holding CommunityCard instances
        Effects:
        Retrieves and removes the first card in the collection of Community Cards or null if it is empty.

        Returns:
        A ChanceCard instance or null.
        Modifies:
        this.chanceCards - Collection holding ChanceCard instances
        Effects:
        Retrieves and removes the first card in the collection of Chance Cards or null if it is empty.

      • getSquareById

        public domain.Square getSquareById(int id)
        Finds a Square object in this Board from its id.
        Parameters:
        id - Id of a Square object
        Returns:
        A Square object or null
        Effects:
        Returns a Square object in the board with the id given as the argument if it is contained in this Board, else returns null.

      • getLayerNum

        public int getLayerNum(domain.Square sq)
        Finds the index of layer which is holding a specific Square object.
        Parameters:
        sq - The Square to be searched.
        Returns:
        A layer number or -1
        Effects:
        If sq is contained in this Board, returns its layer number between 0 and 2 (inclusive) else returns -1.

      • getPositionInLayer

        public int getPositionInLayer(domain.Square sq,
                              int layer)
        Finds the position of a Square object in a given layer.
        Parameters:
        sq - The Square to be searched.
        layer - Index of a layer in this Board.
        Returns:
        A position or -1
        Effects:
        If sq is present in layer returns its index at layer else returns -1.

      • getSquares

        public domain.Square[][] getSquares()
        Gives Square objects contained in this Board.
        Returns:
        A 2-dimensional Square array
        Effects:
        Returns an array Square objects contained in this Board. Each call to this method returns a new array. (The order of the Square objects are preserved.)

      • getLayerLength

        public int getLayerLength(int layerNum)
        Finds the length of a desired layer in this Board.
        Parameters:
        layerNum - Index of the desired layer.
        Returns:
        Length of a layer or 0.
        Effects:
        If layerNum is between 0 and 2 (inclusive), returns its length else returns 0.

      • getSquareAt

        public domain.Square getSquareAt(int layer,
                                 int position)
        Finds the Square instance at the desired position in the desired layer.
        Parameters:
        layer - Desired Layer Number
        position - Desired Position in layer
        Returns:
        A Square object
        Requires:
        0 <= layer < Number of Layers and 0 <= position < Length of layer
        Effects:
        Returns Square object at the desired Position in desired Layer.

        Gives the colors of Estate instances contained in this Board.
        Returns:
        A String[][]
        Effects:
        Returns an array containing colors of Estate objects contained in this Board.

      • getColorAmount

        public int getColorAmount(java.lang.String colorName)
        Finds how many Estate instances with the given color are contained in this Board.
        Parameters:
        colorName - Name of the desired color (in lower case).
        Returns:
        A non-negative integer.
        Requires:
        colorName must be in lower case.
        Effects:
        Number of Estate objects with desired color.

      • addToPool

        public void addToPool(int amount)
        Adds a given amount of money to the pool.
        Parameters:
        amount - A non-negative integer representing the amount of money which will be added to the pool.
        Requires:
        amount must be non-negative.
        Modifies:
        this.pool
        Effects:
        Adds amount to the pool, does nothing if the requirement is not met, throws an ArithmeticException if pool + amount is greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE.

      • withdrawFromPool

        public void withdrawFromPool(int amount)
        Takes a given amount of money from the pool.
        Parameters:
        amount - A non-negative integer representing the amount of money which will be subtracted from the pool.
        Requires:
        amount must be non-negative.
        Modifies:
        this.pool
        Effects:
        Subtracts amount from the pool, does nothing if the requirement is not met.

      • collectHalf

        public int collectHalf()
        Gets half of the money accumulated in the pool.
        Returns:
        A non-negative integer
        Modifies:
        this.pool
        Effects:
        Halves the value accumulated in the pool and returns the subtracted amount. Note that if the total money in the pool is an odd number, the returned amount of money will be one less than the remaining amount.

      • getPool

        public int getPool()

      • move

        public void move(Player player,
                 int diceValue)
        Moves the given Player object according to the given dice value.
        Parameters:
        player - Player to be moved
        diceValue - Sum of the pips on the dice
        Requires:
        player must not be null and diceValue must be greater than 0.
        Modifies:
        player
        Effects:
        Moves player according to diceValue, makes the player pass the Square objects on the way to its destination and triggers the square action of the Square that player has stopped on, if the requirements are not met, throws IllegalArgumentException.

      • moveDirectWithoutSquareAction

        public void moveDirectWithoutSquareAction(Player player,
                                          domain.Square square)
        Simulates the "move direct" command specified in the Ultimate Monopoly game rules, but doesn't trigger the square action.
        Parameters:
        player - Player to be moved
        square - Destination Square
        Requires:
        player must not be null and square must be contained in this.board.
        Modifies:
        player
        Effects:
        Places player to square without passing any Square objects on the way, if the requirements are not met, throws IllegalArgumentException.

      • moveDirect

        public void moveDirect(Player player,
                       domain.Square square)
        Simulates the "move direct" command specified in the Ultimate Monopoly game rules.
        Parameters:
        player - Player to be moved
        square - Destination Square
        Requires:
        player must not be null and square must be contained in this.board.
        Modifies:
        player
        Effects:
        Places player to square and triggers the square action of square without passing any Square objects on the way, if the requirements are not met, throws IllegalArgumentException.

      • switchLayerByTransitStation

        public void switchLayerByTransitStation(Player player)
        Simulates a layer change by a Transit Station in a game of Ultimate Monopoly.
        Parameters:
        player - Player to be moved
        Requires:
        player must be on a TransitStation contained in this.board.
        Modifies:
        player
        Effects:
        Places player to the other end of the TransitStation in which player is initially located, if the requirement is not met, throws IllegalArgumentException.

      • goToJail

        public void goToJail(Player player)
        Sends a Player to jail.
        Parameters:
        player - Player to be sent to Jail
        Requires:
        player must not be null.
        Modifies:
        player
        Effects:
        Places player to Jail in this.board and marks player as in jail, if the requirement is not met, throws NullPointerException.

      • moveMrm

        public void moveMrm(Player player)
        Simulates the "Mr. Monopoly Bonus Move" specified in the Ultimate Monopoly game rules.
        Parameters:
        player - Player to be moved
        Requires:
        player must not be null.
        Modifies:
        player
        Effects:
        Moves player according to the rules of Mr. Monopoly Bonus Move specified in the game rules.

      • repOk

        public boolean repOk()
        Checks whether the representation invariant of this object holds or not.
        Returns:
        true if the representation invariant holds for this otherwise false.
